head.title: Treasury Offerings Set for This Week

hedline.hl1: Treasury Offerings Set for This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.93 percent and 5.97 percent on a six-month bill. In when-issued trading the two-year note was offered at a price to yield 6.25 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills and a two-year note being auctioned on Wednesday.

By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.93 percent and 5.97 percent on a six-month bill. In when-issued trading the two-year note was offered at a price to yield 6.25 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week:
TAXABLE ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Chase Capital VIII, $200 million of $25 trust preferred , Aa3/A-/---. Chase Bank Hambrecht & Quist and Salomon Smith Barney. (Source: MCM CorporateWatch)
New Jersey Education Facility Authority, $132.8 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
Orange County, Fla., $302.2 million of revenue bonds. Competitive.
North East Independent School District, $155.9 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
TAX EXEMPT ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Michigan, $123 million of certificates of participation. Merrill Lynch & Co.
New Jersey Housing, $110 million of debt securities. Merrill Lynch & Co.
Port of Seattle, Wash., $370 million of revenue bonds and revenue refunding bonds. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Private College and University Authority, $130 million of debt securities for Emery University in Georgia. PaineWebber Inc.
Route 3 North Improvement Corp., $300 million of debt securities for Massachusetts. Salomon Smith Barney.
St. Louis Airport, $85 million of debt securities. Salomon Smith Barney.
